m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- Surrender at Ft. Calhoun The nation’s smallest nuclear power plant, at 479 MW, threw in the towel this week Ft. Calhoun surrounded by Missouri River flood waters June 2011 The management of Omaha Public Power District (OPPD) has recommended that the single-unit Fort Calhoun nuclear power station in Nebraska be permanently shut down. Rising costs, record low natural gas prices, and flat or declining demand for electricity made it impossible to run the reactor in the black.
